actor_awards.notes: Whitmore is a recipient of the 'EGOT' distinction, having won a Tony (Special Award, 1948), a Grammy (Best Spoken Word, 1976), and an Emmy (Guest Actor, 2000). He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960.

filmography.title: The Shawshank Redemption
filmography.role_description: The elderly, institutionalized prison librarian who struggles tragically to adapt to life outside the prison walls after being paroled.
filmography.plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

filmography.title: Battleground
filmography.role_description: A tobacco-chewing, frostbitten platoon sergeant who leads his weary men through the Siege of Bastogne with grit and dry humor.
filmography.plot: A squad of the 101st Airborne Division copes with the fog, snow, and Nazi siege of Bastogne during the Battle of the Bulge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Asphalt Jungle
filmography.role_description: A loyal, hunchbacked diner owner and getaway driver who is recruited for a major jewelry heist.
filmography.plot: A major jewel heist is planned and executed by a group of criminal specialists, but the scheme falls apart due to bad luck and double crosses.

filmography.title: Them!
filmography.role_description: A brave New Mexico state police sergeant who teams up with the FBI and scientists to battle giant mutant ants.
filmography.plot: Nuclear tests in the desert result in the growth of gigantic mutant ants who threaten to destroy mankind.

filmography.title: Give 'em Hell, Harry!
filmography.role_description: A tour-de-force one-man show portraying the 33rd President of the United States through his personal and political life.
filmography.plot: A filmed record of James Whitmore's one-man stage show in which he portrays President Harry S. Truman.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Planet of the Apes
filmography.role_description: The orangutan leader who presides over the tribunal of Taylor, representing the dogmatic religious establishment of ape society.
filmography.plot: An astronaut crew crash-lands on a planet in the distant future where intelligent talking apes are the dominant species, and humans are the oppressed and enslaved.

filmography.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
filmography.role_description: The aggressive American admiral who commands the aircraft carrier task force during the days leading up to the Pearl Harbor attack.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: Black Like Me
filmography.role_description: A white journalist who chemically darkens his skin to travel through the Deep South and experience life as a Black man.
filmography.plot: Based on the true story of John Howard Griffin, a white reporter darkens his skin to experience racial segregation in the South firsthand.

filmography.title: Kiss Me Kate
filmography.role_description: One of two gangsters who arrive backstage to collect a gambling debt and end up part of the Shakespearean production.
filmography.plot: A divorced acting couple team up for a musical version of 'The Taming of the Shrew,' but their off-stage bickering mirrors the play.

filmography.title: The Next Voice You Hear...
filmography.role_description: An average American factory worker whose life is turned upside down when he hears the voice of God on the radio.
filmography.plot: The voice of God is heard on the radio all over the world, causing an average American family to re-examine their lives.

filmography.title: Oklahoma!
filmography.role_description: The protective, shotgun-toting father of Ado Annie who insists on a wedding for his daughter.
filmography.plot: In the Oklahoma territory at the turn of the 20th century, two young cowboys vie with an evil ranch hand and a peddler for the hearts of the women they love.

filmography.title: Madigan
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking police official who tries to balance his friendship with the commissioner and the realities of street police work.
filmography.plot: Two detectives have 72 hours to track down a killer after he steals their guns, while the police commissioner deals with internal corruption.

filmography.title: The Majestic
filmography.role_description: An elderly resident of a small town who discovers the amnesiac protagonist on the beach and helps him find a new life.
filmography.plot: In 1951, a blacklisted Hollywood writer gets into a car accident, loses his memory, and settles in a small town where he is mistaken for a long-lost son.

filmography.title: The Relic
filmography.role_description: A museum scientist and mentor to the protagonist who becomes involved in the investigation of a creature killing people in the museum.
filmography.plot: A homicide detective and an evolutionary biologist join forces to stop a giant creature that is killing people in a Chicago museum.

filmography.title: Above and Beyond
filmography.role_description: The security officer for the Manhattan Project who is responsible for the secrecy surrounding the atomic bomb mission.
filmography.plot: The story of Colonel Paul Tibbets, the pilot of the Enola Gay, the plane that dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Music (Scoring), Best Story

filmography.title: All the Brothers Were Valiant
filmography.role_description: A mutinous crew member on a whaling ship who foments trouble between the two brothers commanding the vessel.
filmography.plot: Two brothers, one good and one bad, struggle for command of a whaling ship and the love of the same woman.

filmography.title: The Split
filmography.role_description: A member of a criminal gang recruited to rob the Los Angeles Coliseum during a football game.
filmography.plot: A criminal recruits a team of experts to rob the box office of the Los Angeles Coliseum during a sold-out football game.

filmography.title: Waterhole No. 3
filmography.role_description: A U.S. Cavalry officer pursuing a stolen shipment of gold bullion in this western comedy.
filmography.plot: A comedic western about a stolen map leading to buried gold and the various rogues who try to claim it.

filmography.title: The Harrad Experiment
filmography.role_description: A professor who, along with his wife, conducts a controversial experiment in sexual freedom and communal living at a college.
filmography.plot: A college professor and his wife conduct an experiment in human relations by having male and female students live together as couples.

filmography.title: Face of Fire
filmography.role_description: A well-liked handyman who is horribly disfigured while saving a child from a fire and is subsequently ostracized by the town.
filmography.plot: A local handyman saves a doctor's son from a fire but is disfigured in the process, leading the townspeople to turn against him.

filmography.title: Who Was That Lady?
filmography.role_description: A TV writer who concocts a wild scheme involving the FBI to help his friend cover up marital infidelity.
filmography.plot: A chemistry professor's wife catches him kissing a student, so his friend invents a story that he is an undercover FBI agent to save his marriage.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Comedy

filmography.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
filmography.role_description: An aging knife-thrower and family man who joins the new group of seven gunmen to rescue a revolutionary leader.
filmography.plot: A new team of seven gunmen is hired to rescue a Mexican revolutionary leader from a brutal military prison.

filmography.title: Chuka
filmography.role_description: A scout for a besieged fort who helps the gunfighter Chuka defend against a massive Arapaho attack.
filmography.plot: A gunfighter tries to save the inhabitants of a remote fort from an imminent attack by starving Arapaho Indians.

filmography.title: Mrs. O'Malley and Mr. Malone
filmography.role_description: A Chicago lawyer who teams up with a Montana widow to solve a murder mystery on a train to New York.
filmography.plot: A lawyer and a widow find themselves mixed up in a murder investigation while traveling by train to New York City.

filmography.title: I Will Fight No More Forever
filmography.role_description: The U.S. Army general tasked with pursuing Chief Joseph and the Nez Perce tribe, despite his personal respect for them.
filmography.plot: The true story of the U.S. Army's pursuit of the Nez Perce tribe as they attempt to flee to Canada to avoid being forced onto a reservation.
